description: The Piedmont Police Explorer Program is an opportunity for young adults between the ages of 14 and 21 years to become exposed to a career in law enforcement. The program is part of "Learning For Life", a school career based education program that is sponsored by the Boy Scouts of America. Participate in ride-a-longs with officers on patrol and serve the community by working at community events and assisting with other services provided by the police department when needed. Explorers wear uniforms and hold positions of rank within their organized structure.
